Article.Abstract: Activation of dengue serotype-cross-reactive memory CTL during secondary dengue virus (DV) infection is thought to be important in the pathogenesis of dengue hemorrhagic fever. To model this effect, we studied the CTL responses to DV types 2 (D2V) and 3 (D3V) in PBMC from an individual previously infected with D3V. DV-specific CD8+ CTL from this donor recognized two HLA-B62-restricted epitopes on the NS3 protein, aa 71-79 (SVKKDLISY) and 235-243 (AMKGLPIRY). Both D3V-specific and D2V/D3V-cross-reactive CTL clones were detected for each epitope; all D2V-reactive CTL clones could lyse D2V-infected autologous cells. CTL responses to both epitopes were detected in bulk cultures stimulated with D3V, but PBMC stimulated with D2V recognized only the 235-243 epitope. IFN-gamma enzyme-linked immunospot assay showed that the D2V (71-79) peptide (DVKKDLISY) did not efficiently activate T cells. Analysis of a CTL clone suggests that the D2V (71-79) peptide acts as a partial agonist, able to sensitize target cells for lysis and inducing only minimal proliferation at high concentrations. These results suggest that variant peptide sequences present in the heterologous DV serotype can influence the CTL response in vivo during secondary DV infection.
Article.ArticleTitle: Partial agonist effect influences the CTL response to a heterologous dengue virus serotype.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte;NS3 protein, flavivirus;Peptide Fragments;Viral Nonstructural Proteins;Serine Endopeptidases;RNA Helicases
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Adult; Clone Cells; Cytotoxicity, Immunologic(immunology); Dengue Virus(classification; immunology); Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte(immunology; metabolism; physiology); Humans; Immunologic Memory; Lymphocyte Activation(immunology); Peptide Fragments(agonists; immunology; metabolism); RNA Helicases; Serine Endopeptidases; Serotyping; T-Lymphocytes, Cytotoxic(immunology; metabolism; virology); Time Factors; Viral Nonstructural Proteins(immunology; metabolism)

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Shortest peptide recognized by 4 CTL clones from a dengue-3 (D3) immunized individual. All the clones are MHC class I B62 restricted. This peptide is also recognized equally by bulk PBMCs culture stimulated with either D2 or D3 virus. Swiss-Prot entry is for polyprotein precursor, and position numbers of epitope in the precursor are different than in the processed final protein.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 year previous to this study, this individual had received Dengue 3 vaccine Strain CH53489

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from a DV3 vaccinated donor were stimulated in bulk culture with Dengue 3 or Dengue 2 virus and clones were established by limiting dilution. Cells were restimulated every 2 weeks.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lysis of APCs loaded with this epitope is dose dependent. Developed from a D3 vaccinated individual, 4 clones recognizing the epitope were generated. Of these, 3 were established by D3V restimulation (2 of which also recognize NS3 protein from serotypes D2 and D4, while one is D3 specific) and 1 was established by D2V restimulation (shown to be cross-reactive with D2 and D4 NS3 protein).

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 year previous to this study, this individual had received Dengue 3 vaccine Strain CH53489

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from a DV3 vaccinated donor were stimulated in bulk culture with Dengue 3 or Dengue 2 virus and CTL activity was assayed 8-9 days later.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lysis of APCs loaded with this epitope is equally effective when bulk PBMC cultures (derived form a Dengue 3 (D3V) vaccinated individual) are stimulated with D2V or D3V types, implying cross-reactivity between this epitope and the D2V related epitope D2-NS3 234-242.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 year previous to this study, this individual had received Dengue 3 vaccine Strain CH53489

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from a DV3 vaccinated donor were stimulated in bulk culture with irradiated peptide-pulsed autologous PBMCs and CTL activity was assayed 9 days later.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: APCs infected with recombinant vaccinia encoding either the NS3 protein of D3V or from D2V, including the related epitope D2-NS3 234-242 are both lysed by bulk cultures stimulated with this epitope, implying cross-reactivity between this epitope and the D2V related epitope.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Peptide recognized by CTL from a dengue-3 (D3) immunized individual, generated by bulk PBMCs culture stimulated with either D2 or D3. Swiss-Prot entry is for polyprotein precursor, and position numbers of epitope in the precursor are different than in the processed final protein.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 year previous to this study, this individual had received Dengue 3 vaccine Strain CH53489

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from a DV3 vaccinated donor were stimulated in bulk culture with peptide pulsed irradiated PBMCs and CTL activity was assayed 9 days later.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: APCs infected with recombinant vaccinia encoding either full-length or truncations of NS3 protein from D2V or from D3V including the related epitope D3-NS3 235-243 were lysed by bulk cultures from a D3V vaccinated individual stimulated in vitro with this epitope, implying cross-reactivity between this epitope and the D3V related epitope.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 year previous to this study, this individual had received Dengue 3 vaccine Strain CH53489

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from a DV3 vaccinated donor were stimulated in bulk culture with Dengue 3 or Dengue 2 virus and CTL activity was assayed 8-9 days later.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lysis of APCs loaded with this epitope is equally effective when bulk PBMC cultures (derived form a Dengue 3 virus (D3V) vaccinated individual) are stimulated with D2V or D3V types, implying cross-reactivity between this epitope and the D3V related epitope D3-NS3 235-243.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Shortest peptide recognized by 4 CTL clones from a dengue-3 (D3) immunized individual. All the clones are MHC class I B62 restricted. This peptide is also recognized by bulk PBMCs culture stimulated with D3, but not stimulated with D2, where homolog peptide is identical except for Ser 71 to Asp. Swiss-Prot entry is for polyprotein precursor, and position numbers of epitope in the precursor are different than in the processed final protein.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 year previous to this study, this individual had received Dengue 3 vaccine Strain CH53489

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from a DV3 vaccinated donor were stimulated in bulk culture with Dengue 3 virus and clones were established by limiting dilution. Cells were restimulated every 2 weeks.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lysis of APCs loaded with this epitope is dose dependent. From a D3V vaccinated individual, 4 clones recognizing this epitope were established by stimulation with D3V (2 of which also recognize NS3 protein from serotype D2 and 2 which are D3 specific).

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 year previous to this study, this individual had received Dengue 3 vaccine Strain CH53489

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from a DV3 vaccinated donor were stimulated in bulk culture with Dengue 3 and clones were established by limiting dilution. Cells were restimulated every 2 weeks.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Proliferation of a D3-NS3 71-79 specific CTL clone when stimulated with this epitope was observed. Cytotoxic activity was also seen, but the D2 homologue peptide failed to induce proliferation and was weaker at inducing lysis, implying strain specificity in the memory response, even when the sequences of the corresponding peptides are highly homologous.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 year previous to this study, this individual had received Dengue 3 vaccine Strain CH53489

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from a DV3 vaccinated donor were stimulated in bulk culture with Dengue 2 virus and CTL activity was assayed 8-9 days later.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: No lysis of APCs loaded with this epitope was seen when bulk PBMC cultures (derived form a Dengue 3 (D3V) vaccinated individual) were stimulated with D2V, implying strain specificity of the memory CTL stimulation capacity, even when the sequences of the corresponding peptides are highly homologous and D3V stimulated CTLs are able to lyse epitope pulsed APCs.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 year previous to this study, this individual had received Dengue 3 vaccine Strain CH53489

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from a DV3 vaccinated donor were stimulated in bulk culture with Dengue 3 virus and CTL activity was assayed 8-9 days later.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lysis of APCs loaded with this epitope is seen when bulk PBMC cultures (derived form a Dengue 3 (D3V) vaccinated individual) are stimulated with D3V.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 year previous to this study, this individual had received Dengue 3 vaccine Strain CH53489

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from a DV3 vaccinated donor were stimulated in bulk culture with Dengue 3 virus and CTL activity was assayed 8-9 days later.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: APCs infected with recombinant vaccinia encoding either full-length or truncations of NS3 protein of D3V or from D2V, including the related epitope D2-NS3 234-242, are lysed by bulk cultures stimulated with this epitope, implying the D2V related epitope is being recognized by T cells generated against this epitope.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This peptide is not able to induce lysis by bulk PBMC cultures from a D3 immunized individual, stimulated in vitro with either D3 or D2, where homolog peptides from these strains are identical except for Asp 71 to Ser. This is caused by the partial agonist effect of this epitope on D3-NS3 71-79 specific memory CTLs. Swiss-Prot entry is for polyprotein precursor, and position numbers of epitope in the precursor are different than in the processed final protein.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 year previous to this study, this individual had received Dengue 3 vaccine Strain CH53489

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from a DV3 vaccinated donor were stimulated in bulk culture with Dengue 3 virus and CTL activity was assayed 8-9 days later.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lysis of APCs loaded with this epitope is seen when bulk PBMC cultures (derived form a Dengue 3 (D3V) vaccinated individual) are stimulated with D3V, implying the memory cells elicited by D3V are cross reactive.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 year previous to this study, this individual had received Dengue 3 vaccine Strain CH53489

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from a DV3 vaccinated donor were stimulated in bulk culture with Dengue 3 and clones were established by limiting dilution. Cells were restimulated every 2 weeks.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: No proliferation was seen in a D3-NS3 71-79 specific CTL clone when stimulated with this epitope. These results imply strain specificity of the memory response, even when the sequences of the corresponding peptides are highly homologous.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 year previous to this study, this individual had received Dengue 3 vaccine Strain CH53489

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from a DV3 vaccinated donor were stimulated in bulk culture with Dengue 2 virus and CTL activity was assayed 8-9 days later.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: No lysis of APCs loaded with this epitope is seen when bulk PBMC cultures (derived form a Dengue 3 (D3V) vaccinated individual) are stimulated with D2V, implying strain specificity in the memory CTL stimulation capacity, even when the sequences of the corresponding peptides are highly homologous and D3V stimulated CTLs are able to lyse epitope pulsed APCs.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 year previous to this study, this individual had received Dengue 3 vaccine Strain CH53489

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from a DV3 vaccinated donor were stimulated in bulk culture with irradiated peptide-pulsed autologous PBMCs and CTL activity was assayed 9 days later.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: APCs infected with recombinant vaccinia encoding either the full-length or truncations of NS3 protein from D2V or from D3V including the related epitope D3-NS3 235-243 are not lysed by PBMC bulk cultures (from a D3V immunized donor) stimulated with this epitope, showing that this epitope lacks the ability to restimulate the CTL memory pool, even when the sequences of the corresponding peptides are highly homologous and cross-reactive actiity can be obtained with D3 epitope stimulation.This is attributed to a partial agonist effect of this epitope in the D3V epitope specific T cells.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 year previous to this study, this individual had received Dengue 3 vaccine Strain CH53489

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from a DV3 vaccinated donor were stimulated in bulk culture with Dengue 3 and clones were established by limiting dilution. Cells were restimulated every 2 weeks.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Cytotoxic activity against peptide-pulsed APCs is seen by a D3-NS3 71-79 specific CTL clone, albeit requiring higher concentrations of this epitope than the cognate D3 epitope.
